link.description: Settling in essentials guide your integration into Japanese daily life by covering ward office registration for essentials like your resident certificate (住民票), MyNumber card, and national health insurance; opening a foreigner-friendly bank account at spots like Japan Post Bank or SMBC with tips for easy verification; picking a phone plan via affordable MVNOs (like Rakuten Mobile) or the big three (Docomo, AU, Softbank); prepping for emergencies with numbers like 110 (police) and 119 (fire/ambulance), earthquake basics (drop, cover, hold), and apps to install such as Yurekuru Call for alerts; and spotting real communities through trusted expat meetups while dodging fake ones that prey on newcomers.
